subject: Education
title: Praise: Process vs. Person
description: A short lesson to help you apply Praise: Process vs. Person.

hook.text: 'You're a genius!' feels great. 'You used a great strategy!' builds learners. The difference is huge.

buildup.text: Praise is the most common reward teachers giveâ€”and the most misunderstood.

discovery.text: Person praise ('you're smart') ties success to fixed identity. Process praise ties it to effort.

twist.text: After person praise, children lie about their scores to protect the 'smart' label.

climax.text: Process praise builds resilience because failure reflects strategy, not self-worth.

punchline.text: Praise the work, not the worker.

quiz.question: Why is process praise more effective than person praise?
options: It ties success to effort and strategy, which learners can control
It is easier for teachers to deliver in a busy classroom
Person praise has been banned in most school systems
